review: I have an Old XD Roku with HD and there is no upgrade software offer, I do not want to spend $100 for their new box and here's Fire Stick with more memory. My old Roku doesn't have You Tube and is so sluggish. The Fire stick is great for me as I can stream Amazon Prime, Hulu Plus, You Tube, Netflix,.. with one device. The first thing you do when you get this device is the software update and then it's fine. Great product, kudos to Amazon for coming with a great product. PS. I do have chromecast, but I am using fire stick more.. hope more channels/Apps come to Fire Stick in the future

review: This thing is so cool! Got it today and love it. If you're a Prime member, and/or have a Fire tablet, you shouldn't hesitate to get this.I had been watching Prime and Netflix with my PS3 but won't any more.The Fire Stick does so much more than just let you watch videos. Your cloud photos and videos are instantly accessible on your TV as well as your music and Prime playlists.The only negatives I can see so far is that there's no off switch, only sleep, and it needs to be plugged in.Oh, and the Prime radio stations haven't made it onto the fire tv yet. Hopefully they'll add those in soon.Everything I've started with it, music, videos, prime movies, etc. has started quickly and played back perfectly.The Fire TV remote app is pretty great too. The voice search was able to decipher everything I said on the first try. La Dolce Vita, Alice in Wonderland, Transparent, etc.Amazon did a great job with this one!I've been using mine all day now and haven't had any problems with the wifi dropping.
author: stacey

review: This item worked great.  All I had to do is plug it into the HDMI on my TV, plug power supply into it and it was ready to operate.  Next I had to connect it to WiFi and it was up & running.  I was pleased with it.

review: There's a required tutorial video. It doesn't tell me how to get to "search" after installing the Netflix app.Wifi is slow and flaky; other devices play HD content well, but this kept dropping to low bit rates. I asked it to show me family friendly games playable with the remote, and it said there are six. The Wii U has more games than that.I got the initial Prime deal, so I'm happy to have an HDMI-stick computer I can root and reuse for $20.  But for $40, I can't imagine being happy with this.
